intro: Limnanthemum indicum var. siamense, commonly known as the Siam star flower, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Passifloraceae and is characterized by its star-shaped, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as a climbing or trailing vine with opposite, heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow with red or orange markings, attracting various pollinators. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments.
